title: Meet the 2025 Board Member Cohort!
content: MCN is excited to welcome three new members to its Board of Directors : Maria Paula Arias, Amanda Dearolph, and Aaron Miller. Each will serve a three-year term, bringing fresh perspectives and a range of expertise to MCN’s strategic direction. Also renewing for a second three-year term is Max Evjen. Please join us in congratulating each of them on their appointment! As we welcome the new cohort, we also want to extend our sincere thanks to outgoing board members Martin Franzini, Jen Holmes...
creator: MCN

title: A Local’s Guide to Minneapolis
content: MCN is excited to welcome you to Minneapolis for the 2025 conference . This page provides a curated list of recommendations from Twin Cities locals to help you find whatever you might need while you are in town. Below you will find suggestions for restaurants, local art highlights, and places to meetup outside of the conference.  You can also reference this custom Google Map with all of the recommendations listed below. For information about accessible transit, sidewalks, and venue access, ...
creator: MCN

title: Introducing the MCN 2025 Co-Chairs and Volunteer Coordinator
content: We’re excited to announce the MCN 2025 Conference Co-Chairs and Volunteer Coordinator. As Co-Chairs, Aaron Cohen and Aaron Miller will shape the development of this year’s conference program, bringing a wide range of experience in museum technology, strategy, and community engagement. Barbara Mazer will serve as Volunteer Coordinator, supporting the many individuals who help bring the conference to life. Learn more about each of them below. Conference Co-Chairs Aaron Cohen Aaron Cohen is t...
creator: Josh Schnapf

title: Meet the 2024 Board Member Cohort!
content: MCN is pleased to welcome four new members to its Board of Directors : Claire Blechman, Beth Fischer, Scott Gillam, and Ryan Waggoner. Each will serve a three-year term, bringing fresh perspectives and a range of expertise to MCN’s strategic direction. Please join us in congratulating each of them on their appointment! As we welcome the new cohort, we also want to extend our sincere thanks to outgoing board members Andrea Ledesma and Jessica Warchall for their dedication and invaluable con...
creator: MCN

title: Discover the Power of Play at MCN 2024
content: Museums around the world are creating exciting participatory experiences for their visitors by harnessing the potential of games. These five sessions bring the fun–featuring inspiring projects that invite visitors of all ages to engage, create, and play!  1. Augmented Play: Empowering Young Audiences with Immersive Technologies in Museums Marc Barto, Senior Producer Digital, V&A Kathryn Box, Team Leader: Young People and Families, V&A V&A Learning team uses design-led participat...
creator: Katie Reilly

title: Exploring AI’s Impact on Museums at MCN 2024
content: As artificial intelligence continues to reshape industries worldwide, the museum sector is no exception. Several thought-provoking sessions at this year’s conference will explore the multifaceted role of AI in museums. These four presentations offer valuable insights into how this transformative technology is impacting the cultural space: 1. Algorithms & Artifacts: Deciphering AI’s Role in Museums Jessica Herczeg-Konecny, Lead Technical Analyst, Digital Asset Management, The Metropolit...
creator: Josh Schnapf

title: 2024 MCN Board Candidate Application
content: We’re excited to announce the search for passionate and dedicated individuals to join MCN’s Board of Directors!  As a Board member, you’ll play a vital role in shaping MCN’s future. We’re seeking four talented individuals to replace outgoing members whose terms conclude in November. For many  past  and  current  board members, serving on the MCN board is a way to give back to an organization and a community that have supported them throughou...
creator: MCN

title: Top 5 Reasons to come to Lawrence, KS for MCN 2024
content: By Jennifer Talbott and Ryan Waggoner, Spencer Museum of Art We are thrilled to be hosting the 2024 MCN Conference in Lawrence, Kansas! Situated in the heart of the Midwest and easily accessible from Kansas City International airport, Lawrence is a culturally rich, bustling college town full of exciting chef-owned restaurants, a vibrant live music scene, a walkable downtown full of local boutiques and galleries—a welcoming, inclusive, and friendly place to visit. You might not have had “travel t...
creator: MCN

title: Introducing the MCN 2024 Co-Chairs and Volunteer Coordinator
content: Please join us in welcoming this year’s program co-chairs and volunteer coordinator. We are grateful to co-chair’s Beth Fischer, Sabriyah Hassan, and Brittney Oleniacz for their support and creativity as they work with proposal reviewers to build this year’s conference program, and to volunteer coordinator Aaron Cohen as he supports our conference sessions and events in Lawrence, Kansas. Program Co-Chairs Beth Fischer  Beth Fischer is the Assistant Curator for Digital Learning & R...
creator: Josh Schnapf

title: Free Membership for All
content: Dear MCN Community, We’re thrilled to announce a significant change to our membership structure that we believe will further our mission and foster greater inclusivity and accessibility: we’re transitioning from an annual membership fee to a no-cost membership model! We want to ensure that everyone who shares our passion for advancing digital transformation in museums can participate in our community. By removing the barrier of membership fees, we hope that more members will gain access to our S...
creator: MCN

title: Announcing MCN 2024 in Lawrence, Kansas
content: Join us this fall for MCN 2024, hosted in partnership with the Spencer Museum of Art at the University of Kansas, as we bring together cultural heritage professionals from museums and historic sites from North America and beyond.  Following the success of last year’s conference, MCN 2024 provides an engaging space for museum professionals to connect, share knowledge, and explore the latest advancements in digital technologies for museums. We’re finalizing the details now, but th...
creator: MCN

title: Meet the 2023 Board Member Cohort!
content: We’re delighted to announce that MCN’s Board of Directors has appointed Andy Cummins (second term), Caspar Lam, Jonathan Munar, Katie Reilly, Joshua Schnapf, Sara Snyder, and Alice Walker to serve on the Board each for a three-year term, effective November 2023. Please join us in congratulating each of them on their appointment! As new faces join the board, others are leaving when their terms end this November: Suse Anderson, Erin Canning, Lisa Schermerhorn, nikhil trivedi, and Don Youngberg. Pl...
creator: MCN
